Probe

Contains logic for probing operations

Functions
SetProbeSpeed
call Probe.SetProbeSpeed(
speed
);

Set the probe move speed to the specified value.

Notes

Must be within PROBE_MIN_SPEED and PROBE_MAX_SPEED

Parameters
speed

the speed to set the probe

SetProbeRadius
call Probe.SetProbeRadius(
radius
);

Set the probe's defined radius to the specified value.

Notes

Must be within PROBE_MIN_RADIUS and PROBE_MAX_RADIUS

Parameters
radius

the new probe radius

SetSurfaceNormal
call Probe.SetSurfaceNormal(
xcomp,
ycomp,
zcomp
);

Set the surface normal for calculating contact position.  Assumes part coordinates.

Parameters
xcomp

the 'X' part of the normal vector

ycomp

the 'Y' part of the normal vector

zcomp

the 'Z' part of the normal vector

SetTriggerMoveDistance
call Probe.SetTriggerMoveDistance(
distance
);

Set the distance that the probe must move before triggering

Parameters
distance

the desired trigger move distance

Notes

Must be between PROBE_MIN_MOVEDISTANCE and PROBE_MAX_MOVEDISTANCE

SetTolerance
call Probe.SetTolerance(
tol
);

Set the desired tolerance for probe operations

Parameters
tol

the desired tolerance

Notes

Must be between PROBE_MIN_TOLERANCE and PROBE_MAX_TOLERANCE

SetModeNormal
call Probe.SetModeNormal();

Set the probe speed and trigger distance to default values

SetModeFine
call Probe.SetModeFine();

Set the probe speed and trigger distance for fine movements/operation

ExtendProbe
call Probe.ExtendProbe();

If the machine is equipped with an actuating probe, command it to extend to its usable position

Note

If the probe is protected behind an actuating door, this routine will also safely open the door before extending the probe

RetractProbe
call Probe.RetractProbe();

If the machine is equipped with an actuating probe, command it to return to its home/safe position

Note

If the probe is protected behind an actuating door, this routine will also safely close the door after retracting the probe

SelectOffset
call Probe.SelectOffset();

Apply the probe component offset

See Also

OffsetManager.ApplyOffset

DeselectOffset
call Probe.DeselectOffset();

Clear the probe component offset

See Also

OffsetManager.ApplyOffset

Select
call Probe.Select();

Prepare the machine for probe usage.  This function calls:

  • Probe.SelectOffset

  • <Probe.EnableProbe>

  • Probe.ExtendProbe

  • Probe.SetModeNormal

Deselect
call Probe.Deselect();

Notify the machine that the probe is no longer being used.  This function calls:

  • Probe.DeselectOffset

  • Probe.RetractProbe

  • <Probe.DisableProbe>

ProtectedMoveOn
call Probe.ProtectedMoveOn();

Set the probe to Protected Move Mode

See Also

Probe.ProtectedMoveOff

ProtectedMoveOff
call Probe.ProtectedMoveOff();

Disable Protected Move Mode

See Also

Probe.ProtectedMoveOn

GetProbeMode
call Probe.GetProbeMode(
&probeMode
);

Get the current move mode of the probe.

Response Parameters
&probeMode

The current mode.

Defined Probe Modes
PROBE_MODE_CUSTOM

the mode used when the probe has been manually configured, e.g. by calling Probe.SetProbeSpeed

PROBE_MODE_NORMAL

the default mode, selected by calling Probe.SetModeNormal

PROBE_MODE_FINE

the fine mode, selected by calling Probe.SetModeFine

GetProbeSpeed
call Probe.GetProbeSpeed(
&probeSpeed
);

Get the current move speed of the probe.

Response Parameters
&probeSpeed

The current speed

GetProbeRadius
call Probe.GetProbeRadius(
&probeRadius
);

Get the current radius of the probe tip

Response Parameters
&probeRadius

The current tip radius

GetProbeStatus
call Probe.GetProbeStatus(
&result
);

Query the status of the probe

Reponse Parameters
&result

the current probe status

Status Values
-1

The probe is triggered

0

The probe is ready

-2

The probe is not selected

ProbeMachCoord
call Probe.ProbeMachCoord(
ProbeDir_i,
ProbeDir_j,
ProbeDir_k,
&res
);

Perform a probe operation in machine coordinates

Parameters
ProbeDir_i

The 'i' (or 'x') probe direction

ProbeDir_j

the 'j' (or 'y') probe direction

ProbeDir_k

the 'k' (or 'z') probe direction

See Also

Probe.ProbePartCoord

Reponse Parameters
&res

the result of the operation

ProbePartCoord
call Probe.ProbePartCoord(
ProbeDir_i,
ProbeDir_j,
ProbeDir_k,
&res
);

Perform a probe operation in part coordinates

Parameters
ProbeDir_i

The 'i' (or 'x') probe direction

ProbeDir_j

the 'j' (or 'y') probe direction

ProbeDir_k

the 'k' (or 'z') probe direction

Reponse Parameters
&res

the result of the operation

See Also

Probe.ProbeMachCoord
